summary: Census reports, as well as Rauner's previous statements, refute this.

statements.quote: My grandparents were proud immigrants to the United States of America, here to Illinois in the late 1800s. My grandparents did not speak English when they were young.
Illinois is a state built by immigrants. My grandparents were immigrants.
You know I got my values from my grandfather, he was my best buddy growing up. He was an immigrant, didn't speak much English, he spoke Swedish.
Americaâ€™s built on immigration, my grandparents were immigrants and I would like to see us a welcoming state for immigrants from all over the world.
My best friend growing up was my grandfather on my mom's side. Swedish immigrant. Didn't speak much English.

name: Bruce Rauner's grandparents were immigrants
